comment: Inspiring person! Makes you feel confident about the class. His tests can be stressful, simply because of pressing for time, but I never made lower than a B. My favorite professor I took my freshman year.
Dr. Rump is the Truth. I took him as a freshmen and soon thereafter changed my major to philosophy. Huge impact on me as an intellectual, and as a man.

If you have a chance to take a class with this professor don't miss it. He makes the class interesting, lending most of the class time to discussion. Prepare to participate and think critically. There are a few very short papers, which he grades fairly and gives great feedback. Overall awesome, enthusiastic teacher.

He does an excellent job of breaking down complex concepts. His enthusiasm prevents the course from being boring or tedious. Gives an impartial overview of various viewpoints. A lot of writing, but his grading was fair and his feedback was excellent. I would recommend him/this course to anyone who wants to become a more well rounded student.

This professor was FANTASTIC. If you're looking for an easy A, don't take this class. There's a LOT of writing to do, & attendance is mandatory, but he gives plenty of feedback on papers and is more than happy to meet in his office. He is passionate & intelligent, unbiased, & not to mention stylish. This was my favorite class so far. TAKE HIM!!!

What a wonderful professor! It isn't an easy A, but he wants his students to do well. It actually serves the purpose of a "critical thinking" core requirement. It's 90% writing, and you have to attend lecture- but I actually enjoyed it! Take him!! You will be a better student for it, and it's fun!

He is very enthusiastic about teaching and he wants you to learn the material.He is less interested in the memorization of the material and more focused on the application of it instead. Going to class is pretty vital to earning a good grade because he puts the reading into layman's terms. I recommend him highly.

Prof. Rump was excellent at making difficult content understandable. He really knows his stuff and understands that it may not be as simple to comprehend for the students. He breaks the material down to the best of his ability using real-life and relatable examples. He grades fairly and gives you thorough and detailed feedback. Great professor!

This class is probably one of my favorite classes so far at KSU.  Professor Rump is very passionate about his subject, which makes the class even more interesting.  He is very willing to help and does his best to aid in helping the class grasp the concepts. The class is a good balance of lecture and discussion.
My favorite professor I had this semester. Explained everything really well.

I completely disagree with the comment that we is arrogant and condescending! He is very neutral on the subjects and allows us to discuss with eachother, while he directs the conversation. Overall, he is a great professor. The class is extremely insightful. Although it can be difficult, the class is very structured. I would take him again.

Professor Rump is a new professor, but has a very clear, structured class. This class is not n easy A, however the discussions and topics covered are extremely interesting. Also, attendance is very important not only for your grade, but it is also very helpful being in the discussion, because that is what helps you truly understand the topics.

Do not take this class if you want an easy A; he holds you to very high standards. He is very smart but a little arrogant and condescending at times. He takes forever to get grades back to you. I would avoid him if you are not a philosophy major.

He is a down-to-earth professor, but grades strictly to start the year. It is not an easy A, but the in-class discussion is rather entertaining. Don't take him if you are not a philosophy major and only care about getting an A in the course.
